intro: Callitris gracilis, commonly known as the slender bishop pine, is a small to medium-sized evergreen conifer native to the arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and conical shape, which help it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, woody cones that contain seeds, typical of the Cupressaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland dune areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry climates.
